critique: The document is an executive order focused on promoting energy efficiency in American manufacturing. It encourages investment in energy-efficient technologies like combined heat and power (CHP) systems. The order aims to reduce energy costs for industrial users, improve U.S. competitiveness, create jobs, and reduce air pollution. It directs executive departments and agencies to coordinate policies, engage stakeholders, and provide technical assistance to states and manufacturers. The order also sets a national goal of deploying 40 gigawatts of new, cost-effective industrial CHP by the end of 2020.
